title: Supermoon
description: The full moon will be at its closest approach to Earth.

title: Total Lunar Eclipse
description: A total lunar eclipse will be visible in parts of the world.

title: Meteor Shower Peak
description: The Quadrantid meteor shower will peak, with up to 120 meteors per hour.

title: Spring Equinox
description: The day when day and night are approximately equal in length.

title: Summer Solstice
description: The longest day and shortest night of the year in the Northern Hemisphere.

title: Harvest Moon
description: The full moon closest to the autumnal equinox, providing extra light for harvests.

title: Meteor Shower Peak
description: The Perseid meteor shower will peak, with up to 100 meteors per hour.

title: Perseid Meteor Shower Peak
description: Expect up to 100 meteors per hour in dark sky conditions.

title: Autumnal Equinox
description: The day when day and night are approximately equal in length.

title: Total Solar Eclipse
description: A total solar eclipse will be visible across parts of North America.

title: Lunar Eclipse
description: A penumbral lunar eclipse will be visible in parts of the world.

title: Winter Solstice
description: The shortest day and longest night of the year in the Northern Hemisphere.

title: Total Solar Eclipse
description: A total solar eclipse will be visible across parts of North America.

title: Winter Solstice
description: The shortest day and longest night of the year in the Northern Hemisphere.

title: Spring Equinox
description: The day when day and night are approximately equal in length.

title: Lunar Eclipse
description: A penumbral lunar eclipse will be visible in parts of the world.

title: Summer Solstice
description: The longest day and shortest night of the year in the Northern Hemisphere.

title: Gemini Meteor Shower Peak
description: One of the most reliable meteor showers, with up to 120 meteors per hour.

title: Lyrid Meteor Shower Peak
description: A meteor shower that can produce up to 20 meteors per hour.

title: Orionid Meteor Shower Peak
description: A meteor shower associated with Halley's Comet, producing about 20 meteors per hour.

title: Quadrantid Meteor Shower Peak
description: A meteor shower that can produce up to 120 meteors per hour, best viewed in the early morning hours.

title: Leonid Meteor Shower Peak
description: Known for its spectacular meteor storms, with rates of up to 15 meteors per hour.
